meanings.definition: Gurns (verb): to make a distorted facial expression, especially in amusement or pain.
meanings.sent1: She gurns when she tries to imitate funny faces.
meanings.sent2: He gurns whenever he watches a comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The clown's gurns had everyone laughing at the circus.
meanings.sent4: Her face gurns in agony as she stubs her toe.
meanings.sent5: The child's exaggerated gurns were the highlight of the school play.

meanings.definition: Gurns (noun): a distorted facial expression, often made for entertainment or to show pain.
meanings.sent1: His gurns always make us burst into laughter.
meanings.sent2: The actor's gurns added humor to the scene.
meanings.sent3: The baby's gurns while eating mashed peas were adorable.
meanings.sent4: The gurns on the wax figure made it look almost lifelike.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's exaggerated gurns were the talk of the town.
